title: Beneficiary Moves Into Inherited Property

scenario_info.name: Beneficiary Moves Into Inherited Property
scenario_info.description: Sarah inherits her father's investment property (which was NOT his main residence). She moves into the property as her main residence for 4 years before selling. Because the property was not the deceased's main residence, Sarah cannot use the 2-year rule. However, she can claim the main residence exemption for the period she lived there.

expected_result.notes: Small taxable portion due to 16-day delay before moving in. After 50% discount.

applicable_rules: ITAA97 s118.195: 2-year rule NOT applicable (property was NOT deceased's main residence)
Sarah inherits father's cost base and acquisition date
ITAA97 s118.185: Partial main residence exemption for period Sarah lived there
Small taxable portion due to 16-day delay before moving in

property_history.description: Father's original purchase - used as investment property
Father rented property from purchase - never lived in
Father passes. Property was his investment property (NOT his main residence). Inherited by Sarah.
Sarah receives property as beneficiary. Tenant vacates.
Sarah moves in as her main residence

properties.notes: Partial main residence exemption (98.98%). 2-year rule does NOT apply because property was father's investment, not his main residence. Sarah inherits father's cost base. Only the 16-day vacant period before Sarah moved in is taxable.

user_query: I inherited my father's investment property in 2020 - he never lived there, it was always rented. I moved in and made it my main residence for 4 years. What's my CGT when I sell?
